Reviews.Title: Good tv.
Reviews.Author: AyOlet
Reviews.Content: Good TV. I mean not for the TV enthusiast. Got if for my grandmother to replace her 500 year old tube tv. She needed something simple so she wouldn't need lots of remotes and chaining inputs and stuff to watch  a DVD. The tv has fine picture, not great. If you are looking for a sharp nice pictures get quality brand like Vizio, Samsung, Sony, etc.... there is a reason they cost more. BUT for her It works just perfectly and she can watch some DVDs and Cable. So five stars to that.

Reviews.Title: About what I expected for the money
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Ok, going into this purchase I understood that I wasn't buying a top of the line piece of electronic equipment, but when something is listed as a feature I expect it to work as advertised. All I have been able to get out of the built in dvd player is 480i resolution. For something that advertises an upscaling dvd player as part of the package, that is unacceptable. It may be that I haven't found something in the settings, but if it's there I also can't find it in the documentation or through emailing tech support.Another issue with this tv is that the sound level seems set to one output -LOUD.Those issues aside, the tv is cheap. For my purposes (preschool age kids' playroom), it suits it's purpose as something that may accidentally get damaged by a flying wiimote. Any other purpose and I would return this for something else.

Reviews.Title: could do alot worse
Reviews.Author: professer
Reviews.Content: its really got a great picture for a 720 hdtv. i love all the extra features on this tv. we also use it in our rv when we go fishing. the dvd player is very handy. then we can take the memory card out of the camera and check out our fishing pictures on our tv. i just love it.

Reviews.Title: Does what it needs to do
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Meyer
Reviews.Content: Ordered as a birthday present for a teen-ager since the price was right.  First one was out of box failure as the DVD player didn't work.  Amazon promptly sent a replacement and it worked fine.  Works as advertised.  Actually pleasantly surprised with the picture quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: Coby 32" TV/DVD combo
Reviews.Author: Angela Perrin
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 of these TV's for Christmas gifts, one quit working within 30 days. I contacted Coby Elec. and they emailed the information I needed to return this item and Coby had a new TV delivered to me within 15 days. Very impressed with their warranty and the way they stood behind it. But, it did cost me $75 to ship it UPS back to them.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Grandma Rosie
Reviews.Content: Like everything I buy from Amazon, this TV also impressed me.  The price, quality, and the fact that my 9 yr. old grandson uses it for his Wii and his shows and loves the big screen, makes it a winner.

Reviews.Title: Horrible...
Reviews.Author: Motherof5
Reviews.Content: When we received our t.v. I set it up with my husband and the next day we wanted to put a movie in for our kids...the DVD player doesn't work! That was the whole reason we purchased this one! Also,about 3 weeks later after using the t.v. it has these weird lines that go right through the picture! I am so dissapointed! It was such a waste of $$$! Do not buy this item! You will regret it!

Reviews.Title: Remote Doesn't Work
Reviews.Author: L.M.Fields "Author & Digital Artist"
Reviews.Content: Fresh out of the box this TV/DVD combo is very sleek. I love it's high impact black look and all the great extra features that allow you to have a wide variety of options, but unless you have a working remote control, you can count on this television doing nothing more than looking good. The remote that came with the television had working batteries included but we didn't know it until we put a fresh AAA set in. The remote simply doesn't work. There is only so much you can do manually, you really NEED a working remote control. Now we have to buy a universal remote and hopefully that will solve the problem.

Reviews.Title: reat deal for the price......if lasting
Reviews.Author: oly
Reviews.Content: Coby TFDVD3295 32-Inch 720p Widescreen LCD HDTV/Monitor with DVD Player and HDMI Input (Black)Great deal for the price... if lasting.  Good image, acepptable sound, great alternative if you don't look for professional features and don't like dealing with many devices and cables like I don't.  From now on, everything depends how long it is going to last working. I have been lucky before,  hopefully I will do it again.  Good luck to you.

Reviews.Title: Coby 32" TV/DVD Combo
Reviews.Author: aj
Reviews.Content: I knew this was not one of the best brands when I purchased, but with the built-in DVD player it served my purpose.  Unfortunately the volume control did not work properly.  There was no grading of volume.  Even on level 1, it was very loud,as loud as level 15, making it impossible to watch in the night for fear of disturbing others.  I also had some trouble with it taking in a dvd disc.  It strained a while before it could get the disc in and it occurred repeatedly.I had to return.  Will look for a more reliable brand.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this POS
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I bought this tv after seeing it in the store. It has a horrible sound, an awful grainy picture, and the STOCK remote isn't programmed to work with the correct buttons. So do yourself a solid and spend about 2% more and save yourself some heartache.

Reviews.Title: Sound is terrible and it has no output for external sound
Reviews.Author: william l schofill
Reviews.Content: Sound is terrible!  Horrible!  No outputs for external speakers either.  Really lousy and I should have paid $40 more to get speakers with my tv.

Reviews.Title: junk
Reviews.Author: waagtod "waagtod"
Reviews.Content: I have this TV,I got it free with a lease on a new car. Coby refused to give any help, the remote has never worked, you cannot get a universal remote to work with this TV and the sound is lousy. I was given another Coby 32 LCD TV by a friend and that one had the same problems PLUS on the menu you can't access most of the adjustments including anything about the channels. If you really hate someone, give them a Coby product.

Reviews.Title: Be Cautious!
Reviews.Author: Thomas R
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV from Adomora. I regret this buy. When I plugged the TV in, the TV would not turn on. I found out that the seller has a no return policy. Their solution was to contact the manufacturer. I would not recommend buying this TV from Adomara.

Reviews.Title: Never buy COBY
Reviews.Author: Linda Peck
Reviews.Content: Never worked once plugged it in. Coby will only send a replacement not a refund. Plus, Coby wants me to put in a $30 money order for them to send me a replacement. I will never buy from Coby. Amazon is not backing me, their customer. This is not OK.

Reviews.Title: do not buy
Reviews.Author: lawrence pascal
Reviews.Content: Out of the box and hookup,it looked good and the price was right. After a few months, the tv quit and now is trash I cannot even take to the dump.

Reviews.Title: Payed less then 200 bucks for 32 inch flat screen TV with DVD
Reviews.Author: Mr Bud
Reviews.Content: Pulled it right out of the box and powered it up. Power came on just fine. Slapped a DVD in it and played with the volume. That was one of the comments on a review, that the volume was not good. Well that was not true the volume is ok, but the speakers; sound quality is what is hurting it. Ran the DVD player for about 1.5 hours worked great, hooked up the satellite system and program it that took about 10-15 minutes. Played with all the different settings it has for about an hour, so in all I had it on for about 3 1/2 hours found no big problems. I shut it off and on about dozen times fired right back up. Again another comment was the TV is slow to come on well this is true however it is much faster than my computer is. But it does take about 5-7 seconds. I can remember the warm up time was much longer with vacuum tubes. So, I think 5-7 seconds is very tolerable. For me!So in a nutshell I give it 3 starts for:1) Speakers sound quality is fair2) History has not shown that this flat screen will last, I hope to report that this is false in the future and that will change its ratingSide note: I will hook up a pair of better speakers just to see what effect it has on the sound. Let you know how that works.Update 9/16/2012Wife loves it, she feels the same as I do for what we payed for it, this was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Good for a spare tv
Reviews.Author: DAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 100 year old Grandmother so she could watch dvds without problems.  She could not grasp changing inputs, so it is now a guest room tv.  Not the best picture, bad sound, but cheap.

Reviews.Title: Pretty nice, actually...
Reviews.Author: R. Cuesta
Reviews.Content: Bought this for $220 brand new for the basement.Set it up in my living room for a few weeks to make sure it wasn't going to quit after a day or two, since the warantee's only 30/90 days!It looks and sounds fine.  Not as good as my 52" Sony Bravia, but that was $1500 two years ago.Anyway, I just moved it down the basement and bought a SquareTrade 3-year warantee for it for $25 - THOSE guys are great!So for under $250, I got a pretty nice basement TV.

Reviews.Title: Works pretty well.
Reviews.Author: Laura Noble
Reviews.Content: After seeing other negative reviews of this product, I did have my concerns about buying it.  If I did end up having a problem with it, I had the 30 days to return, so I went ahead and took a chance. I set it up and everything works fine. But don't expect a perfect tv. The issue I have with the tv is when I turn the set off it makes some type of noise shortly after you turn the tv off. It isn't a very loud or intrusive sound, but it's there nonetheless.  It hasn't caused any type of problem so far and I typically unplug the television after using it because I watch tv so seldom. (Unplugged it makes no noise.) In summary, the tv does seems to have its flaws, but for its primary use it works pretty well.

Reviews.Title: DVD does not work correctly
Reviews.Author: michael
Reviews.Content: DVD player is very simple with only a play and stop button. Remote failed so can not even use it to access other features of the TV. Reqested new remote and have not received anything.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointing design or defect
Reviews.Author: Robert S "Robert S"
Reviews.Content: I am an engineer, and spent several days on trying to get this product to work.This TV combines TV and DVD.  On the surface, all looks good, nice remote and slick TV.  Surprises start soon:1) The unit came with about 6 channels set up for the regular "lowest quality -- through the air" TV input source.  Looks like someone else used it before, though I bought it as "new"2) I switched source to HDMI, which is what my cable box is set to.  HDMI worked fine in 480p,l 720p, 1080p.  BUT: turn the TV off, or switch to DVD and back to TV, and input source is back to "air" TV.3) Nothing to do, tried all factory resets, etc.  never can get the unit to stick to HDMI input source, and also cannot get rid of pre-programmed channels.4) DVD works, but it has 3 buttons on it which do not appear to do anything and are not mentioned in manual.  Not reassuring.5) As an engineer, I figure "there must be a hidden factory reset sequence" which may clear all of this up.  So I send two emails to "Technical Support" -- no response after a week (yes, I checked my spam folder)6) Called the tech support number on a Tuesday, midday.  Am told they experiencing "higher than normal call volume".  I hold persistently, through all annoying messages "we'll be with you shortly".  After 35 minutes of hold a tech comes on wanting to know my name, phone number and physical address.  Finally we get to the point.  She checks with a number of technicians.  All suggested "reset" actions I had already tried on my own, none work.  Final outcome:  "Sorry, you will have to always switch from air TV to HDMI (a complicated 6-stroke sequence) *every time* you turn on the TV -- that's just the design of this TV.  Can I do anyting else for you today?"  Shrugging on my 2ndary request re pre-programmed channels that I cannot change.I am returning this unit to Amazon, a bit disappointed, as I am not used to buying defective or terribly-designed products from them.Will never buy another Coby product.
